ygData.messageBody:
Well put. That is what I am talking about, a limited crossover at very high
levels. You would have to spend training points in the new area and be
limited to a subset of spells, plus have to research them all. I think it
would add an interesting element to the higher levels. More of a hobby than
a real threat to the actual class whose spells you could learn.

-- Elidain

> -----Original Message-----
> From: VorteksJRC@... [mailto:VorteksJRC@...]
> Sent: Sunday, May 23, 1999 7:39 PM
> To: EQ_spell_research@onelist.com
> Subject: [EQ_spell_research] Cross Research
>
>
> From: VorteksJRC@...
>
> I think research and use of other classes spells is a good idea, as
> long as there is a penalty for doing so. It would be cool if you
> could learn
> others spells from half your level. I.E. a level 40 wizard could
> learn level
> 20 necro spells. Or if the spells were less effective. But "jack of all
> trades" mages would be very annoying. My strengths as a magician
> are the only
> advantage I have over the other mage classes. But still....
>
>
> I guess what I'm saying is cross research could be beneficial if
> implemented
> properly. But simply any-mage-can-learn-any-spell policies would be
> disasterous.
>
> -Vorteks the High Elf Magician
